column1: The residence requirement significantly restricts the freedom of movement for refugees and poses an obstacle in their search for employment.
column2: Asylum seekers should remain within the district where they are accommodated.

column1: Snowmaking systems may seem attractive in the short term, but they lack long-term future prospects.
column2: The state should continue providing funds for the modernization and expansion of snowmaking facilities.

column1: Museums should be less regulated in terms of the tools they use for making profit.
column2: Entrance to state museums must be free for everyone.

column1: The bargaining parties, unions, and employers should set wages, not the state by law.
column2: Companies with state contracts must be required to pay a higher minimum wage.

column1: Minimum wage should not be differentiated based on the client.
column2: Companies with state contracts must be required to pay a higher minimum wage.

column1: "We maintain that children in the first and second grades receive written information about their learning development instead of grades."
column2: Students should receive grades starting the first grade.

column1: "In times of low interest rates, one could use additional revenue for investments instead of paying off debts."
column2: We propose that additional tax revenues should be primarily used for debt reduction.

column1: We believe merging theater will lead a loss of individual and creative diversity.
column2: We support the organizational merger of the state theater and private theaters in small cities while maintaining their venues.

column1: We believe unemployed people should receive support in the form of assistance for social and personal problems.
column2: Recipients of unemployment benefits should receive continuously reduced funding if they decline job offers.

column1: "We will abolish long-term tuition fees."
column2: Fees for long-term students in the state should be maintained.

column1: "We are fundamentally in favor of a lifelong entitlement to free education."
column2: We support maintaining fees for long-term students in the state.

column1: Long-term students are a significant part of our electorate. We still need them."
column2: We support maintaining fees for long-term students in the state.

column1: Farmers should decide individually on the number of livestock.
column2: We are planning to implement a limit on the total number of livestock in agricultural farms.

column1: The size of livestock is not a criterion for the quality of animal husbandry."
column2: We are planning to implement a limit on the total number of livestock in agricultural farms.

column1: "Employees should have time for family on Sunday. There is enough shopping time during the week due to the long opening hours."
column2: Businesses should be allowed to extend their Sunday opening hours.

column1: "We are opposed to identity checks at the border with Poland."
column2: The continuation of permanent border controls at the Poland border is necessary.

column1: "If a headscarf is used as a political weapon, it can already be prohibited today."
column2: Headscarves for female teachers in public schools must be banned.

column1: "We reject a car toll for social and ecological reasons."
column2: We support implementing tolls for the use of highways.

column1: "The maintenance, expansion, and use of the road network in Germany is already financed by drivers through taxes."
column2: We support implementing tolls for the use of highways.

column1: Cost burden should correspond to the extent of usage.
column2: We support implementing tolls for the use of highways.

column1: We believe that introducing tolls for the use of highways will lead to an overload of bypass roads.
column2: The implementation of tolls for highway usage is advocated.

column1: We need foreigner repatriation programs and not integration programs.
column2: We advocate for more funding for projects aimed at the integration of foreigners.

column1: Research that can be practically applied does not belong in our universities.
column2: Research for military purposes should be allowed at public universities.

column1: "The military has no place in schools of any kind."
column2: Research for military purposes should be allowed at public universities.

column1: "Foreigners must enjoy the right to hospitality, but not the right to vote."
column2: We support granting local voting rights to all foreigners who have permanent residince.

column1: Public broadcasting is an institution that is an essential part of public services."
column2: The number of radio programs should be reduced.

column1: We believe religion must remain a private matter."
column2: Denominational religious education should continue to be offered in our schools.

column1: "Small businesses would be unduly disadvantaged compared to large and high-revenue companies if we introduce minimum tax rate.
column2: We support the implementation of an EU-wide minimum tax rate for businesses.

column1: There must not be any compulsion for a doctor to conduct abortions.
column2: We will ensure that more clinics offer abortion services.

column1: "If Germany doesn't deliver arms abroad, others will."
column2: We advocate for a general ban on arms exports by German companies.

column1: "Currently, we have no plans to lower the minimum participation required for referendums."
column2: It must be significantly easier to initiate referendums.

column1: "Environmental protection is homeland protection."
column2: We propose reducing funding for the National Park.

column1: We believe that any type of service should be paid for.
column2: We support making public transportation free of charge throughout the state.

column1: "Revenue from ticket sales is an indispensable pillar for financing public transport.
column2: Public transportation should be free of charge throughout the state.

column1: Air traffic, not only over regional airports, should be restricted as much as possible to protect the environment.
column2: The continued operation of regional airports should persist.

column1: "We want to enable more people to live in home ownership.
column2: We are raising the property transfer tax in Hamburg.

column1: We don't approve that hospitals are increasingly becoming business enterprises."
column2: We will continue to bill inpatient hospital treatments through a fixed case rate system.

column1: "Healthcare must be ensured regardless of financial issues and the financial circumstances of the patients."
column2: We will continue to bill inpatient hospital treatments through a fixed case rate system.

column1: Children should be informed about the advantages, disadvantages, or dangers of religion."
column2: We support the elimination of religious education in public schools.

column1: "The free decision-making power of businesses regarding opening hours leads to an infringement on workers' rights."

column1: "We believe that positive aspects of our country's history should be highlighted more."
column2: We believe that visiting memorial sites that commemorate the crimes of National Socialism should remain mandatory for all students.

column1: "EU solo efforts in so-called 'climate protection' disadvantage the European economy and are ineffective."
column2: We should set higher CO2 reduction targets for the European Union.

column1: "The crisis can only be overcome with certain financial assistance."
column2: We believe that excessive new debt by states in the Eurozone should be penalized, even during an economic crisis.

column1: "Students should have the free choice between participating in religious education or ethics classes."
column2: Religious education should be removed from public schools.

column1: "Synthetic pesticides are harmful as toxins to our flora and fauna and therefore ultimately harmful to humans as well."
column2: Agricultural businesses should be permitted to continue using synthetic pesticides.

column2: We support allowing agricultural businesses to continue using synthetic pesticides.

column1: We reject any form of compulsion in educational paths.
column2: We propose making the final year of kindergarten mandatory for all children before they start school.

column1: "The 5% hurdle prevents the representation of the political will of the citizens."
column2: We support maintaining the five percent threshold for elections to the State Parliament.

column1: "Diversity in public-service broadcasting is important."
column2: The number of radio programs by WDR should be reduced.

column1: "We are not against unisex toilets, but there are more urgent problems and more important investments than such a regulation."
column2: We propose that every public building in the country should have at least one unisex toilet accessible to all genders.

column1: "Merging into a unified state police involves more disadvantages than advantages."
column2: We support the merger of the Bremen and Bremerhaven police forces into a unified state police.

column1: "Everyone has the right to move freely."
column2: Asylum seekers in Saxony should be permitted to move freely only within the state.

column1: "The level of social basic security must be oriented towards the capability of the member states and is a national competence."
column2: The EU should set standards for the minimum level of social welfare in member states.

column1: "Religious education should convey knowledge of all religions.
column2: Islamic religious education should be offered at schools.

column1: We reject any form of religious education in public schools."
column2: We support offering Islamic religious education at schools.

column1: "Brothels should be allowed to open within the existing regulations.
column2: We support a ban on issuing operating permits for new brothels.

column1: "Granting the right to vote to foreigners would mean that politicians would increasingly disregard the interests of the locals.
column2: We support granting all permanently residing foreigners the right to vote in district council elections.

column1: "The EU should increasingly invest in joint European peace projects."
column2: We support continued investment in joint European defense projects.

column1: "Peace is created at the negotiating table, not through armament."
column2: Continued investment in joint European defense projects should be maintained.

column1: "The term of a prime minister should be only decided by the vote of the citizens."

column1: "Youth are at an age where they are easily manipulated and seldom able to analyze politics correctly."
column2: Lowering the voting age to 16 for state elections should be implemented.

column2: We support increasing the recruitment of individuals with migration backgrounds in the police force.

column1: "The salaries result from the different training of the teachers."

column1: We stand for the strict separation of religion and state.
column2: We believe the European Union should embrace its identity as a community founded on Christian values.

column1: "Criminal law does not solve the problems of drug policy, but in some cases worsens them."
column2: Stricter enforcement against the possession of illegal drugs is necessary.
Continued recruitment of foreign nursing staff is necessary.

column1: "Due to the increased willingness to resort to violence against police officers, we consider it inappropriate to individualize the police forces."

column1: "The 'stay-at-home allowance' is based on an ultra-conservative family image."
column2: We advocate for providing childcare benefits to parents whose children do not attend daycare.

column1: "The presumption of innocence must fundamentally apply first.

column1: cities and municipalities should be able to decide on their tax policies themselves.

column1: We should show respect to our culture.
